required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Systolic Notching in Pulmonary Embolism
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Accuracy of Early Systolic Notching in Pulmonary Embolism

brief_summary.textblock: Venous thromboembolism (VTE), clinically seen as deep vein thrombosis (DVT) or pulmonary embolism (PE), is the third most common acute cardiovascular syndrome after myocardial infarction and stroke. In a study conducted by critical care and emergency physicians, lung ultrasonography (US) for pleural infarction areas, lower extremity venous US in terms of DVT, and focused cardiac US in terms of right ventricular strain were demonstrated with different diagnostic values for PE. However, no ultrasonographic method alone has a high diagnostic value for PE alone in the literature. In a recent study, it is stated that a new cardiac finding (early systolic notch- ESN) has high sensitivity (92%) and specificity (99%) in massive and submassive emboli. However, the limited patient population and the exclusion of many patient groups limits the applicability of the study and its use in other patient groups. With this study, it was aimed to determine the diagnostic value of ESN finding within the emergency department conditions by keeping the patient population wider.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the diagnostic accuracy of the ESN finding
primary_outcome.description: What is the diagnostic value of ESN finding in patients with PE diagnosed with pulmonary CT angio?

study_pop.textblock: Patients who presented to the emergency department and underwent pulmonary CT angio imaging with suspicion of pulmonary embolism.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing pulmonary CT angiography with suspicion of pulmonary embolism
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women,
- Patients under 18 years of age,
- Those who received thrombolytic therapy,
- Poor ultrasound imaging.
